before_start:
{"blocks":[{"key":"firuf","text":"Important Notes Before You Begin","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1nhg4","text":"Review Reagent Preparation section in the manual on NEB.com.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cg15","text":"Store Proteinase K at –20°C upon receipt.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4klrt","text":"Prepare Monarch Carrier RNA based on kit size used: Add 125 μl (NEB #T4010S) or 750 μl (NEB #T4010L/X) nuclease-free water, invert or pipette to mix, and transfer to an RNase-free microfuge tube. Keep on ice. Prepare single-use aliquots and store at –20°C. Avoid multiple freeze-thaw cycles.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgiq8","text":"Prepare 80% ethanol: 80% ethanol should be prepared fresh using 100% ethanol (user supplied) and nuclease-free water (user supplied). Prepare 1 ml of 80% ethanol per reaction and add overage.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6oj95","text":"Perform all steps at room temperature unless directed otherwise.
","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h1lf","text":"Required plastics","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f81dq","text":"KingFisher 96-deep well plates, v-bottom, (2.0 ml), Catalog # 95040450","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2shkg","text":"KingFisher 96 microplate (200 μl), Catalog # 97002540","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1iujm","text":"KingFisher 96 deep-well tip comb and plate, Catalog # 97002820
","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5rfs","text":"Starting Material Notes
This protocol has been optimized for use with wastewater samples that have been pre-processed with Ceres Nanotrap Particles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6551j","text":"The Monarch Mag Viral DNA/RNA Extraction Kit provides a rapid and reliable magnetic bead-based process for extracting viral nucleic acids from saliva and respiratory swab samples. The kit combines the efficiency of silica-based nucleic acid purification with the ease of use of magnetic beads. Manual and automated workflows allow samples to be processed in microfuge tubes or 96-well plates. Kit sizes align to 96-well formats (100 preps, 600 preps, and 1800 preps), and the protocol is compatible with high throughput automation on a variety of platforms, including the KingFisher Flex magnetic particle processor and Agilent Bravo and MGISP liquid handler platforms.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

platform)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mso7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8td1v","text":"Required status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Part I. Prepare the KingFisher Flex Instrument
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4ev7k","text":"Ensure the instrument is equipped with the KingFisher Flex 96 Deep Well head and the KingFisher Flex 96 heating block.\nIMPORTANT: The heat block must be compatible with the KingFisher 96 microplate (200 μl).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part I. Prepare the KingFisher Flex Instrument
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bnsje","text":"Ensure the MagMAX Pathogen RNA/DNA (High Volume) program is loaded onto the instrument’s connected computer and that the program has been modified to perform three 500 μl wash steps, a 2-minute bead drying step, and a 33–100 μl elution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part I. Prepare the KingFisher Flex Instrument
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"an486","text":"Enter sample, wash, and elution volumes into the program.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part I. Prepare the KingFisher Flex Instrument
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ckqq0","text":"Select plate sizes for the run: KingFisher 96-deep well plates (2.0 ml) for sample and wash plates; KingFisher 96 microplate (200 μl) for elution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part II. Buffer Preparation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b1ofi","text":"Prepare fresh Viral DNA/RNA Wash Buffer in a user-supplied tube or bottle (free of nucleases) according to the table.\nAdd components in order, as listed. Prepare up to 15% excess to ensure a sufficient volume is available for each reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part II. Buffer Preparation
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"90jn6","text":"Prepare Lysis Buffer Bead Mix immediately before use, according to the table.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kjfg","text":"a. Vortex magnetic beads to form a homogeneous solution before use.
b. Add components in order, as listed.
c. For a master mix, prepare up to 15% excess to ensure a sufficient volume of buffer/bead mix is available for each reaction.
d. Store Lysis Buffer Bead Mix at room temperature. Periodically invert or vortex to keep beads in suspension.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dp0jb","text":"Viral DNA/RNA Wash Buffer:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eprc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f8u04","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"busuf","text":"Lysis Buffer Bead Mix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"913h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3ts2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_5":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_7":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_8":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_2":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_5":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_7":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_8":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["164","164"],"data":[["","Volume per Reaction"],["a. steps.section: Part III. Prepare Wash and Elution Plates
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b9180","text":"Aliquot 500 μl Viral DNA/RNA Wash buffer to wells in a 96-well deep well plate.\n\t","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part III. Prepare Wash and Elution Plates
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8tl2a","text":"Aliquot 500 μl 80% ethanol to wells in each of two 96-well deep well plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part III. Prepare Wash and Elution Plates
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b2fvq","text":"Aliquot 33–100 μl nuclease-free Water to wells in a 96-well microplate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part III. Prepare Wash and Elution Plates
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ajfe9","text":"Seal plates with an adhesive film until ready to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cju0k","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"535p4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_3":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_4":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_5":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","","","","","",""],"colWidths":["103","100","100","100","100","100","100"],"data":[["Plate Position","1","2","3","4","5","6"],["Plate type","96 deep well","96 deep well","96 deep well","96 deep well","96-well microplate","Tip comb in 96-well microplate"],["Plate Identification","Sample plate","Wash plate 1","Wash plate 2","Wash plate 3","Elution plate","N/A"],["Plate Contents","Sample/Lysis Buffer Bead Mix (approx. 621 μl)","Viral DNA/RNA Wash Buffer (500 μl per well)","80% ethanol (500 μl per well)","80% ethanol (500 μl per well)","Nuclease-free water (33-100 μl per well)","N/A"]],"guid":"1BADDB588B9840DC8AD3074B4DEF4B88","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Plate Position","1","2","3","4","5","6"],["Plate type","96 deep well","96 deep well","96 deep well","96 deep well","96-well microplate","Tip comb in 96-well microplate"],["Plate Identification","Sample plate","Wash plate 1","Wash plate 2","Wash plate 3","Elution plate","N/A"],["Plate Contents","Sample/Lysis Buffer Bead Mix (approx. 621 μl)","Viral DNA/RNA Wash Buffer (500 μl per well)","80% ethanol (500 μl per well)","80% ethanol (500 μl per well)","Nuclease-free water (33-100 μl per well)","N/A"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Part IV. Elute target microbes from the Nanotrap pellet
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4t461","text":"These steps will begin at the end of enrichment, specifically where Ceres protocol adds a Lysis Buffer. For example, for Protocol APP-042, you would follow the Nanotrap protocol till Step 11 and perform the steps below instead of Step 12.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":238}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0p3i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4l9ro","text":"Add 100 μl Monarch StabiLyse DNA/RNA Buffer to the Nanotrap Particle pellet, pipette to resuspend the pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part IV. Elute target microbes from the Nanotrap pellet
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5oqsu","text":"Incubate for 10 mins at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part IV. Elute target microbes from the Nanotrap pellet
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2imbi","text":"Use a magnetic rack that is compatible with sample tubes to separate Nanotrap Particles from the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part IV. Elute target microbes from the Nanotrap pellet
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"df9rf","text":"Transfer the supernatant to a deepwell plate compatible with processing on KingFisher.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part IV. Elute target microbes from the Nanotrap pellet
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"42bps","text":"Sample Lysis (Sample Plate)\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1o1ub","text":"Add 100 μl nuclease-free water to the Nanotrap enriched sample from Step 14 above.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part IV. Elute target microbes from the Nanotrap pellet
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e4aml","text":"111 Add 5 ul Proteinase K.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cr25s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcbbe","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fatgd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"87j5m","text":"Instead of individually performing Step 15 and 16, a master mix of nuclease water and Proteinase K can be made if desired.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Part IV. Elute target microbes from the Nanotrap pellet
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6p3l1","text":"Pipette mix or use a thermomixer for 30 seconds after sealing the plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part IV. Elute target microbes from the Nanotrap pellet
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9mqoq","text":"Incubate for 15 min at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part IV. Elute target microbes from the Nanotrap pellet
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bd81e","text":"Gently vortex the prepared Lysis Buffer Bead Mix and add 421 μl to each sample well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part IV. Elute target microbes from the Nanotrap pellet
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bhta5","text":"Seal plate with adhesive film until ready to load onto the KingFisher Flex instrument.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part V. Viral Nucleic Acid Purification (Bind, Wash, Elute)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ce1vk","text":"Carefully remove adhesive film from sample, wash, and elution plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part V. Viral Nucleic Acid Purification (Bind, Wash, Elute)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cn5vn","text":"Load sample, wash, elution plates, tip comb and plate, into the appropriate positions on the KingFisher Flex worktable.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part V. Viral Nucleic Acid Purification (Bind, Wash, Elute)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"gurr","text":"Run the modified MagMAX program.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Part V. Viral Nucleic Acid Purification (Bind, Wash, Elute)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d848p","text":"Upon completion of the run, seal the elution plate with adhesive film and place on ice for immediate use or freeze for storage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: NEB #T4010 Monarch Mag Viral DNA/ RNA Extraction Kit Protocol for KingFisher Flex Automated Isolation of Viral DNA/RNA from Wastewater Samples Following Ceres Nanotrap Enrichment
